text:
Last year, I got into my first year of engineer school in biomedical specialty. This formation includes computer science, mathematics, electronics, but also biology class and some more specific classes about medical devices and how they work. Many things have influenced my choice.
In my last year of high-school I had no idea of what I will do after my baccalaureat. I have always been interested in science more than in litterature so I oriented my researches in that way. I went to a lot of very interesting meetings where students talk about their studies. I started to take interest in computer science and my parents, who happen to be computer science teachers, really encourage me in this way. But I was also interested in the medical sphere. The problem was that the whole journey to become a doctor was really frigthening me and I didn't want to make more than 5 years studies. And with a little bit of research and chance, I heard about a engineer school in Paris named ESIR, which includes a biomedical specialty. I went to the open gates and met the teachers who explain me what was this specialty about. Then, I apply to get into the preparatory class of the school and after two years, I integrate the biomedical specialty. I don't regret my choice because this specialty is really interesting and I definitely want to work in the biomedical sphere after my graduation.
